Re:Avoiding Context - Whats the point of the second example? It does not ConfigureAwait(false)? Shouldn't this do so and then the example becomes that it throws because we've switched context. i.e. in contrast to the previous example in Context where the context remains the UI thread.

Re: Async Composition why is the second example returning await firstTask? Shouldn't it be returning firstTask.Result? As we already have the task returned via the WhenAny and with two awaits in that method the compiler has to rewrite the method twice right?
